name: Authentic Thai Pork Larb Recipe
description: This authentic Thai pork larb recipe comes together in 15 minutes with the best of Thai flavors.

video.name: กินลาบด้วยกันไหมครับ ##thaifood##farang##fyp##thailand

recipeInstructions.text: Chop the green onions, finely slice the shallots, and cut the lemon.
recipeInstructions.name: Chop the green onions, finely slice the shallots, and cut the lemon.

recipeInstructions.text: Place a pot or pan over low heat. Add the pork and cook without any oil until it’s done. For a saucy dressing, add 3 tablespoons of water.
recipeInstructions.name: Place a pot or pan over low heat. Add the pork and cook without any oil until it’s done. For a saucy dressing, add 3 tablespoons of water.

recipeInstructions.text: Transfer your cooked pork to a mixing bowl. Another option is to toss the salad in your pot, which is often done by street vendors in Thailand.
recipeInstructions.name: Transfer your cooked pork to a mixing bowl. Another option is to toss the salad in your pot, which is often done by street vendors in Thailand.

recipeInstructions.text: Add the fish sauce, toasted rice powder, sugar, red pepper flakes, and lime juice. Toss well to mix.
recipeInstructions.name: Add the fish sauce, toasted rice powder, sugar, red pepper flakes, and lime juice. Toss well to mix.

recipeInstructions.text: Gently mix in the shallots, culantro, green onions, mint, and coriander. Serve immediately.
recipeInstructions.name: Gently mix in the shallots, culantro, green onions, mint, and coriander. Serve immediately.

review.reviewBody: I give this 5 stars! Excellent, even without the rice powder!

keywords: larb moo, larb recipe, pork larb, thai pork salad
